structured.title: Rachel Exposes Abuse in Charismatic Church Culture
structured.overview: Rachel records a long, investigative-style video addressing abuse, fraud, cover‑ups, and spiritual manipulation within the charismatic Christian church, focusing heavily on allegations against prophetic minister Sean Bolz and the leadership culture that enabled him. She explains that he was her “white rabbit” into a broader rabbit hole of corruption, and says she has gathered previously unseen evidence and victim testimonies over the past year. Rachel criticizes prominent leaders such as Bill Johnson, Kris Vallotton, and others in revival/prophetic circles for publicly endorsing Bolz while privately distancing themselves without warning their congregations, framing this as “cover up culture.” She emphasizes that she still believes in spiritual gifts but insists on exposing systemic problems that create and protect abusive leaders, calling for accountability, public rebuke, and reforms in how prophecy and revival culture are practiced. She notes the personal cost of doing this work, anticipates slander against herself, and frames the series as temporary before she returns to her usual Bible study content.

apps_results.content:
## Purpose of the Video  
- Focus on abuse, fraud, and cover‑ups in charismatic churches  
- Centered on exposing prophet figure Sean Bolz  
- Aimed especially at charismatic Christians and church leaders  

## Rachel’s Investigation  
- Spent about one year gathering evidence  
- Spoke with multiple victims of Sean’s spiritual abuse  
- Collected never‑before‑seen documents and witness testimony  

## Cover‑Up Culture in Charismatic Circles  
- Leaders allegedly knew about Sean’s misconduct  
- Victims say leaders failed to warn or protect congregations  
- Culture of denial: public distancing, private knowledge, no transparency  

## Rachel’s Motive and Stance  
- Claims to love charismatic movement and spiritual gifts  
- Not against prophecy or gifts, against fake prophets and healings  
- Series will be demonetized to avoid profit motive accusations  

## Biblical Framing of Public Rebuke  
- Cites command to rebuke elders publicly for others’ fear  
- Rejects quiet distancing without open acknowledgment  
- Frames this exposure as obedience to Scripture  

## Bill Johnson’s Role and Responsibility  
- Bill Johnson heavily promoted Sean in 2016 event  
- Publicly presented Sean as trustworthy prophet to large audiences  
- Rachel argues this endorsement was “atrocious and evil” in hindsight  

## Private Distancing vs Public Silence  
- 2021 text: Kris Vallotton says Sean must “clean up his mess”  
- Bethel team allegedly told to avoid relationship with Sean  
- 2023: Bill appears with Sean on TBN, strongly endorses his book  

## Influence of Bethel and Related Leaders  
- Bethel described as major model for global charismatics  
- Practices and prophetic culture widely copied elsewhere  
- Rachel claims this system helps produce repeat abusive leaders  

## Knowledge Among Other Prophetic Leaders  
- 2022: Stacy Campbell allegedly lists leaders aware of Sean’s danger  
- Indicates problem known in higher prophetic circles  
- Yet no clear public warnings given to ordinary members  

## Next Steps  
- Rachel will release more videos with victims and documents  
- Plans to map connections between leaders, abuses, and cover‑ups  
- Intends to later stop series and return to Bible studies
